result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dana R Teepe was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Dana R Teepe was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(SF) Case called at 01:54 PM 
Defendant Dana R Teepe not in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Beck advises that the State joins in the request of the Department of Corrections that the amounts outstanding be reduced to civil judgment.
ADA Beck advises that the Defendant is being supervised out of Michigan, the State of Michigan is not able to continue to supervise the Defendant on an extension, so the defendant would need to be brought back to the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Beck advises the Court that the State has notified the victim of todays hearing.
Court makes a record that the Court has attempted to arrange a place a time for all parties to appear to have their positions heard by the Court.
Court will terminate the supervision upon it's completion and convert both costs and restitution to civil judgment.

recess: 1:59 pm
Probation review hearing on November 29, 2018 at 01:45 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:23pm. 
Defendant Dana R Teepe not in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Brock is present.
The Court indicates that Mr. Teepe contacted court staff earlier today to say that the person transporting him to court encountered vehicle-problems and he is unable to appear. Arrangements were made for Mr. Teepe to appear by telephone for the hearing, however the Court then excused Mr. Teepe from appearing today. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.  ADA Beck indicates that Agent Brock is proposing that civil judgments be entered on the amount due, rather than there being an extension of the Probation term.  
The Court adjourns the hearing because of the Court's concern about notification to the victims about the intended entry of a civil judgment rather than extension of Probation. 
recess 1:28pm. 

NEXT:  schedule continued Probation Review Hearing on a date before 12/4/18 (this is the date when the current Probation term terminates)
Probation review hearing on November 13, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:22pm. 
Defendant Dana R Teepe in court with Attorney David Westrick.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Probation Agent Billie Brock appears by telephone. 
Attorney Westrick indicates that Mr. Teepe agrees with the proposed extension of the Probation term.  Attorney Westrick indicates that he is looking into information that Mr. Teepe has provided him regarding payments made by State Farm Insurance; Mr. Teepe had full coverage and State Farm has paid on the vast majority of the bills.   Attorney Westrick hopes to confirm with the victim that payment in full has been received through the insurer.
The Court extends the Probation term as requested by the State.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:55 am  (Clerk SF)
Defendant Dana R Teepe in court with Attorney David Robert Westrick. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock advises that the State has victim rights compliance.
The Court so finds.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 & #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

recess: 10:41 am for the Court to review Victim Impact Statement
reconvene: 10:43 am
recess: 10:45 am to allow parties to review Chapter 950 
reconvene: 10:50 am

Court concludes that an insurance company is not entitled to victim/witness notification.
Court and Attorney Westrick discuss defendant's ability to pay restitution.
Attorney Westick informs the Court that they are requesting that restitution amount be held open and the State and Defense can stipulate to the restitution.

recess: 10:54 am
reconvene: 10:54 am
Attorney Westrick informs the Court that they will stipulate to the restitution amount.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 & #4.
Court will order restitution in the stipulated amount.

ADA Shock presents sentencing recommendation.
Attorney Westrick presents sentencing argument.
Defendant makes a statement to the Court.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 180 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for medical appointments and for work release purposes; to commence at the conclusion of the jail time served under Count #3; electronic monitoring is not authorized or approved by the Court
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and approval of agent
--Absolute Sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To comply with DNA sample
--To pay $250 DNA surcharge
--To pay costs
--To pay restitution of $7,494.33 payable to Cheryl E. Clavey formerly Stork

Conditions NOT of Probation:
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 24 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given

On Count #3, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 365 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for medical appointments and work release purposes; to commence forthwith
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $2400 + costs + $200 DNA Surcharge = $3976, Defendant will submit a proposed monthly amount after he is released from custody after the sentence in Count #1 is complete
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered 
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

recess: 11:41 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Hearing: not more than 60 days (To determine defendant's ability to pay)  (Parties may stipulate regarding the defendant's ability to pay)
Final status/scheduling conference on December 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.
to Amend the Information; State's
Amended

case called at 2:01pm. [MK]
Defendant Dana R Teepe in court with Attorney David R Westrick.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appear for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Westrick indicates that the Defense is not opposing the State's filing of an Amended Information.
The Court receives the Amended Information.
Service of the Amended Information admitted; reading waived.
The Court recites the charges and maximum penalties in the new counts, Count #3 and Count #4.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling:  counsel feel they are on-track for the January 8th Jury Trial date, however they are making efforts to finalize a settlement agreement. 
Attorney Westrick requests that the case be scheduled for another FSSC/possible plea and sentencing hearing at least thirty days out.
The Court and parties briefly discuss Mr. Teepe's health status. The Court indicates that it is important that if Mr. Teepe has a hearing in which he intends to enter a change-of-plea, that at the hearing Mr. Teepe's pain management be such that the Defense feels certain that the change-of-plea is being made knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently. 
recess 2:11pm. 
[Post-hearing/off-record the clerk verifies with Mr. Teepe that the Riverview Drive, Janesville address remains current.]

NEXT:  (1) schedule Second FSSC on 12/2/14 at 9:30am (allow one hour),  (2) the 1/8/15 Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar
Jury trial on January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Scheduling Notice
